page.title: 08WESTHAMPNETT AND MAUDLIN
page.content: and Company, Builders Merchants and the Chichester District Council works unit. Further along by Coach Road is the Old School which closed in 1967. This is now a private house. Opposite this is Clay Lane where the new school has been since 1967. Nearby are houses and bungalows, a village pond, an old peoples rest home, the Church and Rectory. There are houses along the A27 and also a garage. Behind most of the houses in the village are arable fields.(by Jacob Pope). {MAUDLIN}As the A27 leaves Westhampnett it enters Maudlin. At Maudlin there is a row of houses on the main road, an Inn called the Coach & Horses, and a Garage. The road forks at Maudlin, one the A27 to Arundel the other the A285 leads to Petworth. There is often a queue of waiting cars here especially in the summer.
